page.title: 11Causeway House, Braintree
page.content: { Causeway House}is the new council offices for Braintree, situated in Bocking End. It was built between July 1979 and January 1981, when the offices were transfered from the Town Hall. The building was officially opened on April 25th 1981. An old school, Bocking End Charity School, used to be on this site. It had however fallen into disrepair and had not been used for many years. On a balcony of the new building they errected the old drain covers which were present on the school building. The new offices have special tiles on the floor, to absorb the noise from each room, so each floor is generally as quiet as possible. The outside doors are alarmed, and there are detectors inside the building which, when switched on after office hours, detect movements.
